DataElement.preferredName: Person Correlative Study Specimen Submission And Collection Information Complete Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to indicate whether the correlative study information related to specimen submission and collection was completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Correlative Study Specimen Submission And Collection Information Complete
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._A type of study that tests for a relationship between a condition and a potential causal factor of the condition._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Property.preferredName: Correlative Study Specimen Submission And Collection Information Complete
Property.preferredDefinition: A type of study that tests for a relationship between a condition and a potential causal factor of the condition.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: A type of study that tests for a relationship between a condition and a potential causal factor of the condition.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
